page.title: 01MAUCHLINE E - NE RURAL AREA
page.content: Difficult to survey due to the lack of roads - only a quarter of this section is easily accessable, using the B7037 Sorn - Galston road. Other roads are single track, some impassable by road. Some of the landscape could be described as wilderness, the rest being mainly rough grazing for Ayrshire co9ws or sheep. There is an occasional field of barley but the majority of the cultivated land is used for silage and hay. Some areas are also quite heavily wooded. While others are marshy. There are no amenities of note and the largest settlement consists of three cottages, a hall and a public telephone at Auchenclaigh. The few other buildings to be seen are farms, notable for their well cared for appearance and Auchmannoch House, built around 1724, this picturesque but slightly
